So again, let's go over the basics...


Gravity/adiabatic/compression the closer to the center of mass you get the warmer the air becomes, the farther away the cooler. In physics it‚Äôs called the Maxwell gravito-thermal theory it has also been coined the Maxwell gravito-thermal greenhouse effect theory. Richard Feynman mentioned the mechanics of the process a few times. 
‚Ä¶
6 basic processes determine a change in troposphere air temperature and of those processes only one does it without the addition of energy. Not one of these processes is the ghge or even supports the theory of the ghge. 


5 are a diabatic process, "A thermodynamic change of state of a system in which the system exchanges energy with its surroundings by virtue of a temperature difference between them".


 1. Conduction: 
>Solar irradiance heats the Earth's surface and by contact the lower troposphere. 


2. Convection:
 >That hot air rises. 


3. Advection:
 >Horizontal movement of air.
 

4. Radiation:
 >Exchanging thermal energy to space. Radiation is thermal energy transferred away from Earth by the emissions of electromagnetic waves to space and the only means of emissions of energy off the planet. 


>80% of the EM radiation escapes to space through the open atmospheric window between 8-13 micron. 


>The 20% that is intercepted by greenhouse gases has created an entire branch of incorrect climate science. A radiative source cannot increase its own temperature.


5. Latent Heat: 
>The water phase which transfers en masse thermal energy from the surface to the atmosphere and powers our climate via the Hadley cells. 


6. Adiabatic Process: "A process in which there is no exchange of heat or mass with the environment. In an adiabatic process, a change in internal energy is solely a consequence of work. For an ideal gas and most atmospheric conditions, compression results in warming, whereas expansion results in cooling."


 >Without work from the outside only this process remains, air expands as it rises and compresses as that air descends. Thus the troposphere functions as a Carnot cycle (as atmospheric science teaches): 


>Reversible isothermal expansion 
>Reversible adiabatic expansion 
>Reversible isothermal compression 
>Reversible adiabatic compression 


Now the lapse rate, "The decrease of an atmospheric variable with height, the variable being temperature, unless otherwise specified." Is reversible, meaning: "Thus the same parcel of air at the surface is warmer than it is as it rises in the atmosphere, just as the potential energy of that parcel of air declines as it moves back towards the earth's surface. The lapse rate cools the hotter air as it rises and warms it as it lowers." 


Kinetic energy/potential energy. 


All energy loss from a heated material is cooling.


The three cooling mechanisms are:
1. Conduction (which in the case of conduction to air in a gravity field leads to convection, the adiabatic process which is flux asymmetric, it acts like a one-way gate).


2. Evaporation ‚Äì all evaporation is cooling. (Remember that Latent Heat is a hidden store of energy, it has no kinetic signature).


3. Thermal Radiation (the diabatic process which is a gradient flux cascade of half out and half back).


And for good measure there is also the issue of thermal inertia; the heat capacity of the body being warmed. The thermal capacity (specific heat) of water is much larger than that of air. Water takes longer to warm and stores more energy.


‚ÄúIt is impossible to radiate potential energy, so when held at elevation in a convection cell the former kinetic energy of the rising air mass is now locked into the air parcel by virtue of its position. This stored energy can only be released when the air descends and it losses potential energy but regains kinetic energy.‚Äù -Geoscience


"The ‚Äúplanet‚Äù does not ‚Äúwarm or cool‚Äù when there is an imbalance given by I = (S/4)(1-a) ‚Äì oeT^4. The ‚Äúplanet‚Äù warms and cools at every moment with the real-time in-situ heat flow." -Physics

text:
Solution on how to handle the "terrified" who fear climate change: Pick any one claim by the alarmists and find something about with which you can agree. This helps the other person feel safe to open up to you. Then, add facts about that topic about which everyone knows. And finally, show how the known facts debunk the original alarm.

Example:
CLAIM: Global Warming will result in a greater number of violent storms and storms of greater strength.

AGREEMENT: Hurricanes passing over warmer ocean waters will pick up more energy and become more dangerous.

FACT: The work of Dr. Ryan Maue shows the strength of tropical cyclones over the last 40+ years on a slight uptrend.

FACT: Wind only blows because of temperature differences. Hot air rises (upward movement of smoke, steam and hot-air balloons), and cold air descends (cool air by your ankles when you open your refrigerator door, or walk into an airconditioned mall).

FACT: The greatest source of heat on the planet is the direct sunlight in the tropics. The greatest source of cold is all of the ice in the polar regions.

FACT: Melt the ice and the difference between poles and tropics will become far less, making strong winds less likely.

FACT: The counts of strong US tornadoes (EF3 through EF5) of the last 60+ years has been on a strong downtrend. In fact, the counts of EF4 and EF5 in 2018 hit zero for the first time since the record was kept.

FACT: Violent storm counts per century during the far colder Little Ice Age were up to 10 times what they were in the 20th century. This is according to the preliminary work of the late Dr. Hubert Lamb, founder and first director of the Climate Research Unit at East Anglia University.

CONCLUSION: The claim that warming will result in stronger storms only applies to tropical cyclones, and not tornadoes. But the counts are trending toward zero. And this should make sense, because if the temperatures were the same everywhere, there would be no energy for wind, and no direction for wind to blow.

The claims of the Warming Alarmists can easily be debunked with an understanding of the science basics, like that in the #1 Weather Bestseller, Climate Basics: Nothing to Fear.
author: Rod Martin, Jr.

text:
C4 crops are very few. They can use CO2 down almost to 0ppm -- extremely low. C3 crops are many, and entirely die at CO2 levels between 50 and 150 ppm. So, most of our food crops almost died out during the last glacial period of the current Ice Age when CO2 levels got to within 30 ppm of Lovelock's CO2 Mass Extinction threshold.

C4 plants did not exist until CO2 levels had fallen consistently below 800 ppm (2x today's level), because those planets had not been able to cope with the extreme CO2 starvation of 800 ppm!!! Life does NOT evolve new species unless there is an extreme need for a different survival paradigm. So, this puts into perspective the idea that doubling our CO2 from 400 to 800 ppm is NOT dangerous, but highly beneficial. We will be returning to extreme starvation levels of CO2!
author: Rod Martin, Jr.

text:
One of the largest critical MISTAKES of the Alarmists involves the CLAIM that Warming is "bad." It isn't!

Fact: We currently live in the most prosperous period of human history, largely because of technology, but also because of the abundant rain driven by warmth, and the fertilizing effect of extra CO2.

Fact: Throughout history, prosperity correlates strongly with periods of warming; famines and societal collapses correlate strongly with periods of cooling.

Fact: Cold oceans produce less evaporation required for abundant, predictable rain.

Fact: During the far colder glacial period of the current Ice Age, deserts were far larger, because there was less evaporation. And, accordingly, human populations could never get above about 100,000 because of the severe lack of food.

Fact: The alarm is aided by the Leftist media showing anecdotal disasters. Those are real disasters, but NOT representative of the planet as a whole. It's like the international news about Los Angeles one winter. 100% was about houses sliding off of hillsides, while 99.99% of Los Angeles was safe from such dangers. Distortions of reality ARE ESSENTIALLY LIES using cherry-picked facts.
author: Rod Martin, Jr.

text: Climate always changes, and most often changes in fairly regular cycles. Right now, we're living in the Modern Warm Period of the Holocene's major warm period, 1,000-year cycle. We've had a warm period peak ten times during the Holocene. Our Modern arrived right on schedule, by nature. But the fact that is the coldest of the 10 major warm periods indicates that CO2 either has negligible effect on global temperatures or zero effect. The correlation between modern warming and modern increases in CO2 is purely accidental! No cause-and-effect relationship!

text: Isn't measuring sea levels kind of a joke? With continental drift, sea floors spreading, under water volcanoes forming, and land masses both rising and sinking, and with actual measurements going up in some places and down in others, what significance can measuring sea levels actually have other than on a local level? I mean if the land you live on is actually sinking into the sea, no amount of climate hysteria legislation is going to do anything to stop it. Better to just get on with life and enjoy the greening of the Earth and slightly less harsh winters.

text:
¬†@B√òRGE ODK¬† ALL scientific hypotheses are subject to modification or replacement. And all scientific hypotheses are WELL DOCUMENTED, and based on FACTS! So, stop IMPLYING that one is necessarily better than the other. Species go for long stretches without any appreciable changes; that's pretty "slow." And then, in a fairly narrow window of time, new species show up like firecrackers. The introduction of C4 plant species is one of many examples. When CO2 was persistently below 800 ppm, species worldwide freaked out enough to evolve a new method for CO2 acquisition to cope with the severe starvation levels of the substance.

Even physical, inanimate matter is designed to "lean" toward greater complexity and life. Even the clumping of particulate matter in a dust cloud. The increased molecular complexity from meteor impact velocities (J. Blank, et al). There's a design to it all; a purpose.

text:
¬†@Sentient Flower¬† 
Marxism is a method of socioeconomic analysis that uses a materialist interpretation of historical development, better known as historical materialism, to understand class relations and social conflict as well as a dialectical perspective to view social transformation. It originates from the works of 19th-century German philosophers Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels. As Marxism has developed over time into various branches and schools of thought, there is currently no single definitive Marxist theory.

Marxism is an idealistic view of the world and leads to nothing but trouble. History is full of bad versions Marxism and the millions death associated with its tyrannical figures who practiced its principles. 

Capitalism isn‚Äôt perfect and neither is western democracy,but it‚Äôs far better than Marxism and communism.

He wrote this fifty years ago.  Not to ruin the story, but at one point he's telepathically linked to an alien, and as they're traveling from the spaceport to the meeting area, he's looking out through the alien's senses.  There are low mounds that are blank, and he asks the alien if they are for privacy.  The alien thinks for a moment, and laughs.  He concentrates on one, and it's the glaring alien equivalent of a billboard.  It didn't show up in the alien's mind, the image was blank because it was being ignored.  
But here's a question. If you've become immune to the advertising, does that put it in the same category as disease?

text:
If you assert that you are experiencing the same weather patterns as before, you are asking for a type of evidence which is unreasonable. i.e. every year would have to be successively more extreme than the last. Weather patterns don't work in a strictly linear fashion.

It is more useful to look at a smoothed pattern. For example the average over the last 10 years vs the 10 year rolling averages for all other years. 


Incidentally, I fully agree with you about the alarmist reactions and the nonsense evidence found in headlines. They don't inform good decisions.  Neither do AOC or Thunberg. 

If these were the only things I ever looked at, or listened to I'd be equally skeptical. 

Would you consider looking at some evidence from a qualified conservative geologist who has read hundreds of papers ?  I'll point you at some videos if you are.

What do you think Feynman was trying to say? That experts are ignorant? No. What he was trying to say was that the scientific progress depends not on trusting result from any given expert but rather on putting trust behind the theory that best explains the preponderance of the evidence. 

In the case of climate deniers like we have here in this comment section, various purported "explanations" for climate change simply do not stack up against the preponderance of the evidence from various independent measurements.

text:
¬†@Chuck Schenck¬† "Bad things happening a long way off, and it's proof of something you can't see."  Sorry, Charley; if you're going to play The Sky is Falling game, you need to hit closer to home.  Here; I'll help you:
"Global warming is causing the poles to melt, and sea level rise will cover the state of Florida!"
There!  Now you've got my attention!  I live in Florida.  Show a map of how much of Florida will be under water in twenty years.  Add in some pictures of New York with water up the windows of the skyscrapers, and you've ramped up the fear factor.  
Except, the data doesn't back up the pending disaster.  Seas have been moving up between 1.5 and 2 mm per year since 1850, and that from marks on a stick.  Satellite measurement says it's 3.2mm per year, but the data doesn't add up;  it's now off by a couple of inches from what harbormasters say.  For whatever reason, the melting of glaciers hasn't changed the rate of change of sea level rise beyond the background rate of silt inflow.  
This claim of "Your home is threatened!" died when exposed to data, like a vampire exposed to sunlight.  
I think the proper question to ask is, "How is your claim that the world is ending any different than all the others?"  I'll grant you: maybe it is, maybe you're right.  But where dozens of other dire predictions have failed to materialize, how is yours different?  Better studied?  Longer term data?  More people with eyes-on?  Persecuted by the fossil fuel industry?  97% of scientists agree?  You want me to be scared into doing research that will yield results of, "She'll be right" (said with an Aussy accent) based upon your claim of "The ocean is dying!" ?  Nah.  I'm going to let you bring extraordinary proof to back up your extraordinary claim.  Fair enough??

text:
¬†@Sheldon¬† The atmosphere is 76% nitrogen, so it is the primary element in the contrail. Nitrogen is shaken up by its passage through the jet turbine and upon emission, it seems to want to form nitrogen oxides. There is a massive quantity of atmosphere that is passing through the jet engine, and of course, it is all contaminated. These new chemicals are unstable and constantly morphing due to the synergetic effects, so they are, in practice, nearly impossible to classify. However, oxygen, in the form of ozone seems to be attracted to the excited nitrogen to form various types of nitrogen oxide. There is a whole column dedicated to nitrogen oxides in the NASA analysis. 
The contrail is a coherent, cylindrical spiral of hot exhaust gasses and particulates that increases in diameter as it cools and descends, and due to its temperature and also to the attraction the rotating mass exerts, water vapour condenses readily so long as the contrail remains warmer than the surrounding air. On the outside of the exhaust plume, there is a very large surface area, which is constantly increasing, to condense water vapour. 
The heat and polluted gasses are exchanged into the water vapour resulting in acid rain, ozone toxicity, and the fallout is cancer producing, cause asthma, and robs the entire atmospheric blanket of water vapour, which it displaces to lower altitudes, thus interrupting the primary hydrological cycle. Also, the missing ozone admits more UV radiation through to the Earth's surface, and undoubtedly this causes the loss of vegetation, and consequently produces more heat. I leave it to your imagination to calculate the effects of so much high altitude water vapour being dragged to lower altitudes while being heated and filled with unknown, and in fact, unknowable chemicals.
There are clear solutions to many environmental issues that would transform the planet if initiated. Please feel free to ask questions, or disagree with anything. I am not an expert on pollution, or jet engines, I just do lots of homework bolstered by many observations, and  supported by photographic evidence.

text:
46 enlightening statements by IPCC experts against the IPCC:

    Dr Robert Balling: The IPCC notes that ‚ÄúNo significant acceleration in the rate of sea level rise during the 20th century has been detected.‚Äù This did not appear in the IPCC Summary for Policymakers.
    Dr Lucka Bogataj: ‚ÄúRising levels of airborne carbon dioxide don‚Äôt cause global temperatures to rise‚Ä¶. temperature changed first and some 700 years later a change in aerial content of carbon dioxide followed.‚Äù
    Dr John Christy: ‚ÄúLittle known to the public is the fact that most of the scientists involved with the IPCC do not agree that global warming is occurring. Its findings have been consistently misrepresented and/or politicized with each succeeding report.‚Äù
    Dr Rosa Compagnucci: ‚ÄúHumans have only contributed a few tenths of a degree to warming on Earth. Solar activity is a key driver of climate.‚Äù
    Dr Richard Courtney: ‚ÄúThe empirical evidence strongly indicates that the anthropogenic global warming hypothesis is wrong.‚Äù
    Dr Judith Curry: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to just spout off and endorse the IPCC because I don‚Äôt have confidence in the process.‚Äù
    Dr Robert Davis: ‚ÄúGlobal temperatures have not been changing as state of the art climate models predicted they would. Not a single mention of satellite temperature observations appears in the IPCC Summary for Policymakers.‚Äù
    Dr Willem de Lange: ‚ÄúIn 1996 the IPCC listed me as one of approximately 3000 ‚Äúscientists‚Äù who agreed that there was a discernible human influence on climate. I didn‚Äôt. There is no evidence to support the hypothesis that runaway catastrophic climate change is due to human activities.‚Äù
    Dr Chris de Freitas: ‚ÄúGovernment decision-makers should have heard by now that the basis for the long-standing claim that carbon dioxide is a major driver of global climate is being questioned; along with it the hitherto assumed need for costly measures to restrict carbon dioxide emissions. If they have not heard, it is because of the din of global warming hysteria that relies on the logical fallacy of ‚Äòargument from ignorance‚Äô and predictions of computer models.‚Äù
Dr Oliver Frauenfeld: ‚ÄúMuch more progress is necessary regarding our current understanding of climate and our abilities to model it.‚Äù
Dr Peter Dietze: ‚ÄúUsing a flawed eddy diffusion model, the IPCC has grossly underestimated the future oceanic carbon dioxide uptake.‚Äù
Dr John Everett: ‚ÄúIt is time for a reality check. The oceans and coastal zones have been far warmer and colder than is projected in the present scenarios of climate change. I have reviewed the IPCC and more recent scientific literature and believe that there is not a problem with increased acidification, even up to the unlikely levels in the most-used IPCC scenarios.‚Äù
Dr Eigil Friis-Christensen: ‚ÄúThe IPCC refused to consider the sun‚Äôs effect on the Earth‚Äôs climate as a topic worthy of investigation. The IPCC conceived its task only as investigating potential human causes of climate change.‚Äù
Dr Lee Gerhard: ‚ÄúI never fully accepted or denied the anthropogenic global warming concept until the furore started after NASA‚Äôs James Hansen‚Äôs wild claims in the late 1980s. I went to the [scientific] literature to study the basis of the claim, starting with first principles. My studies then led me to believe that the claims were false.‚Äù
Dr Indur Goklany: ‚ÄúClimate change is unlikely to be the world‚Äôs most important environmental problem of the 21st century. There is no signal in the mortality data to indicate increases in the overall frequencies or severities of extreme weather events, despite large increases in the population at risk.‚Äù
Dr Vincent Gray: ‚ÄúThe [IPCC] climate change statement is an orchestrated litany of lies.‚Äù
Dr Mike Hulme: ‚ÄúClaims such as ‚Äò2500 of the world‚Äôs leading scientists have reached a consensus that human activities are having a significant influence on the climate‚Äô are disingenuous ‚Ä¶ The actual number of scientists who backed that claim was only a few dozen.‚Äù
Dr Kiminori Itoh: ‚ÄúThere are many factors which cause climate change. Considering only greenhouse gases is nonsense and harmful.‚Äù
Dr Yuri Izrael: ‚ÄúThere is no proven link between human activity and global warming. I think the panic over global warming is totally unjustified. There is no serious threat to the climate.‚Äù
Dr Steven Japar: ‚ÄúTemperature measurements show that the climate model-predicted mid-troposphere hot zone is non-existent. This is more than sufficient to invalidate global climate models and projections made with them.‚Äù
Dr Georg Kaser: ‚ÄúThis number [of receding glaciers reported by the IPCC] is not just a little bit wrong, it is far out by any order of magnitude ‚Ä¶ It is so wrong that it is not even worth discussing.‚Äù
Dr Aynsley Kellow: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not holding my breath for criticism to be taken on board, which underscores a fault in the whole peer review process for the IPCC: there is no chance of a chapter [of the IPCC report] ever being rejected for publication, no matter how flawed it might be.‚Äù
Dr Madhav Khandekar: ‚ÄúI have carefully analysed adverse impacts of climate change as projected by the IPCC and have discounted these claims as exaggerated and lacking any supporting evidence.‚Äù
Dr Hans Labohm: ‚ÄúThe alarmist passages in the IPCC Summary for Policymakers have been skewed through an elaborate and sophisticated process of spin-doctoring.‚Äù
Dr Andrew Lacis: ‚ÄúThere is no scientific merit to be found in the Executive Summary. The presentation sounds like something put together by Greenpeace activists and their legal department.‚Äù
Dr Chris Landsea: ‚ÄúI cannot in good faith continue to contribute to a process that I view as both being motivated by pre-conceived agendas and being scientifically unsound.‚Äù
Dr Richard Lindzen: ‚ÄúThe IPCC process is driven by politics rather than science. It uses summaries to misrepresent what scientists say and exploits public ignorance.‚Äù
Dr Harry Lins: ‚ÄúSurface temperature changes over the past century have been episodic and modest and there has been no net global warming for over a decade now. The case for alarm regarding climate change is grossly overstated.‚Äù
Dr Philip Lloyd: ‚ÄúI am doing a detailed assessment of the IPCC reports and the Summaries for Policy Makers, identifying the way in which the Summaries have distorted the science. I have found examples of a summary saying precisely the opposite of what the scientists said.‚Äù
Dr Martin Manning: ‚ÄúSome government delegates influencing the IPCC Summary for Policymakers misrepresent or contradict the lead authors.‚Äù
Steven McIntyre: ‚ÄúThe many references in the popular media to a ‚Äòconsensus of thousands of scientists‚Äô are both a great exaggeration and also misleading.‚Äù
Dr Patrick Michaels: ‚ÄúThe rates of warming, on multiple time scales, have now invalidated the suite of IPCC climate models. No, the science is not settled.‚Äù
Dr Nils-Axel Morner: ‚ÄúIf you go around the globe, you find no sea level rise anywhere.‚Äù
Dr Johannes Oerlemans: ‚ÄúThe IPCC has become too political. Many scientists have not been able to resist the siren call of fame, research funding and meetings in exotic places that awaits them if they are willing to compromise scientific principles and integrity in support of the man-made global-warming doctrine.‚Äù
Dr Roger Pielke: ‚ÄúAll of my comments were ignored without even a rebuttal. At that point, I concluded that the IPCC Reports were actually intended to be advocacy documents designed to produce particular policy actions, but not a true and honest assessment of the understanding of the climate system.‚Äù
Dr Paul Reiter: ‚ÄúAs far as the science being ‚Äòsettled,‚Äô I think that is an obscenity. The fact is the science is being distorted by people who are not scientists.‚Äù
Dr Murry Salby: ‚ÄúI have an involuntary gag reflex whenever someone says the science is settled. Anyone who thinks the science is settled on this topic is in fantasia.‚Äù
Dr Tom Segalstad: ‚ÄúThe IPCC global warming model is not supported by the scientific data.‚Äù
Dr Fred Singer: ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it remarkable that the Policymakers Summary of the IPCC report avoids mentioning the satellite data altogether, or even the existence of satellites ‚Äî probably because the data show a slight cooling over the last 18 years, in direct contradiction of the calculations from climate models?‚Äù
Dr Hajo Smit: ‚ÄúThere is clear cut solar-climate coupling and a very strong natural variability of climate on all historical time scales. Currently I hardly believe anymore that there is any relevant relationship between human CO2 emissions and climate change.‚Äù
Dr Richard Tol: ‚ÄúThe IPCC attracted more people with political rather than academic motives. In AR4, green activists held key positions in the IPCC and they succeeded in excluding or neutralising opposite voices.‚Äù
Dr Tom Tripp: ‚ÄúThere is so much of a natural variability in weather it makes it difficult to come to a scientifically valid conclusion that global warming is man made.‚Äù
Dr Gerd-Rainer Weber: ‚ÄúMost of the extremist views about climate change have little or no scientific basis.‚Äù
Dr David Wojick: ‚ÄúThe public is not well served by this constant drumbeat of alarms fed by computer models manipulated by advocates.‚Äù
Dr Miklos Zagoni: ‚ÄúI am positively convinced that the anthropogenic global warming theory is wrong.‚Äù
Dr Eduardo Zorita: ‚ÄúEditors, reviewers and authors of alternative studies, analysis, interpretations, even based on the same data we have at our disposal, have been bullied and subtly blackmailed.‚Äù

The New Testament warns against biblical literalism, telling us that the letter (or "ink") leads to death, but the spirit of scripture leads to life. But that takes work and humility. Noah's Flood targeted a very specific species which died at the real Flood date of 27,970 BC. The clues are in Genesis, if you know how to find them. The wording "days were ... years" is part of the clue. The wording of Genesis 6:3 is another part. And Genesis 5:2 gives yet another clue.

In Genesis 2, God told Adam that he could eat of every tree but one. If he were to eat of the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil, he would surely die on that day. Remember this? And at the end of Genesis 3, both Adam and Eve are escorted out of the Garden. In Genesis 5, we learn that Adam lived for 930 "years" which were "days." What happened to Adam "dying on the day" he ate of the forbidden fruit?

Biblical literalists say that the death in the Garden was physical, but it wasn't, for Adam lived for 930 years AFTER the Garden. Literalists say that the death in the Garden means that death did not exist on Earth before then. Wrong again. The death in the Garden was spiritual. The forbidden fruit was physical ego -- the false self which is the "master" of this realm -- the source of all evil. Why would God do this? So that we could use our free will to choose to be closer to Him. And by doing so, we go from being "receivers" (female) to "givers" (male), for it is more blessed to give than to receive. We were created in His image, and God is NOT Homo sapiens!!! Stop being literal about the Bible. Jesus was not. If you are to follow him, you need to stop being literal. Spirit is like nothing in the physical realm.

Reference: The Bible's Hidden Wisdom
